intro: Pentacalia stuebelii, commonly known as the Stuebel's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
